page.title: 02EDUCATION-PEEL PARK-1918
page.content: About{1918}children started school at 3 years of age.Most of the children wore clogs.The headmaster went round the school to inspect the clogs.If they were dirty the pupil was sent home to clean their clogs.There was no school uniform. The teachers were stern and very strict and the headmaster punished pupils by giving them the cane.There were no school dinners so the pupils had to go home for dinner.There were 10 classes and the children stayed in one classroom .The desks did not have lids,they were just like flat benches.Some of the subjects were Mathematics,English,Geography,History, Reading and Writing.School started at 9.00am.and finished at 4.15pm.We obtained this information from two people who were at our school in 1918. By Rachel Burgess and Nicola Heap.
